Posts.Content: On 5/24/2009 I am OK wrote: Be skeptical!  It might save your life!!  I am 47 and found a lump during self exam and called my ob/gyn.  She immediately sent me to The Breast Center for a digital mammogram (always faithful to get annual exams) and nothing showed up.  I was insistent there was a lump so the tech did a sonogram to see.  Nothing.  I took her hand and made her feel the lump.  She did and called the Radiologist in.  The Radiologist did another sonogram in high resolution.  Nothing.  She told me "if it was me, I would keep an eye on it and come back in 6 months".  I took her hand and made her feel the lump.  She said "I can do a needle biopsy if you want but I am sure it is nothing".  I felt like an idiot and went away with a nagging feeling.  After two weeks, I went to see my Ob/gyn again and made her feel the lump.  She called a surgeon who specializes in breast cancers.  I saw him and he assured me, after looking at the films and reports, it was nothing.  He said, "if you cannot believe 3 MD's, 2 mammograms, and 2 sonograms, I will do a biopsy if you want".  One week after the biopsy, I got a call from him.  I had ductal cancer and would need to come in that afternoon.  It's now 7 months later.  I opted for a bilateral radial mastectomy and have never regretted my decision.  I felt if they could not detect the first tumor, how would they ever detect any future tumors?  Because I opted for the bilateral radical mastectomy, I did not have radiation or chemotherapy.  I also chose not to have reconstruction.  I talked to too many women who had reconstruction and then were forced to have as many as five additional surgeries (in the same year) to "tweek or fix" them.  I am happy, cancer free, wear two breast prosthesis', and encourage you to follow your instincts.  On my first meeting with my Oncologist after surgery, she walked into the exam room and said "Mrs. ____, you saved your life".  I also ran into the Radiologist at a Cancer Awareness Dinner who came up to me and apologized.  I don't blame her - the tumor did not show up on any film but I know she will be careful when telling future patients "come back in 6 months".   Would like to know if you ever had a mri.. I also have some lump on my right breast, had a lumptectomy last year on my left breast.. Not in my lympth nodes.. But i feel a lump in my right breast have had it for a long time but they say its breast tissue and fibro cystic breast makes me very nervious but all test ultra sound ,mamo and mri is normal..wanted to know how they biopsy your lump ..thanks katt
Posts.Title: Did anyone's cancer NOT show up on Mammogram or Ultrasound?

Posts.Content: On 5/11/2009 kattt wrote:   On 5/9/2009 Bonniee wrote:   On 4/23/2009 Lindalou wrote: Hello, I'm visiting from the Thyroid Cancer message board and have a question. Did any of you find a lump that did not show up on mammogram or ultrasound but turned out to be malignant? I found a pea size lump 2 weeks ago and went to my gyno. He also felt it and sent me for a diagnostic mammogram with ultrasound. The tech, AND the radiologist could feel it but could see nothing on the ultrasound. I was relieved at first but now I'm wondering if I should still worry. My thyroid cancer was found as a fluke so I'm a little skeptical. Any advise is appreciated!  I have a breast clinical exam by my GYN and I private pay for another one every six mos because my HMO does not offer digital mammograms I have very dense fibrocytic breasts. I thought I would be safer with a digital mammogram, because they are computerized, they are more sensitive with dense breast tissue. In October, the breasts looked ok, but they found a enlarged node in my axillary. Ultrasound was negative and so was the breast MRI. I had an axilliary node disection with 3 positive nodes consistant with infiltrating ductal breast cancer - no breast tumor found. I am in chemo now and an trying to decide on mastectomies - bilateral before radiation. I would have someone biopsy that lump! My thoughts and prayers are with you. Bonnie
Posts.Title: Did anyone's cancer NOT show up on Mammogram or Ultrasound?

Bonnie      to bonnie  , was wondering how did they find out about your positive nodes.please let me know , i have a lump in my right breast but i had a mamo and ultra sound and mri and nothing i real nervous about it. had lump in my left breast removed about 1 year ago that was cancer and it never showed in the mamogram on in the ultra sound.. i get werid pains under my arm and breast area where i had the lumptectomy my nodes were negitive but i think they only took one out to check and it was negitive..thanks katt

Posts.Content: On 4/22/2009 dove111 wrote: I was on arimidex for 3 years and after having all kinds of side affects decided quality of life was more important than being sick all the time.  I have gained 45 lbs., and haven't lost anything after three weeks of weight watchers, in fact I gained 3 lbs.  Has anyone else had this issue and has anyone stopped treatment early due to side affects?   cindy      i have recently stop arimidex made me gain weight swelling problem. i did take for a very shot time  and  stopped taking seem to bother my throat with dryness at times not sure if this was caused by the meds or not.. do get severe bodyaches but not has bad has fermera fermera seems to be to strong for me arimidex.seems not to be as strong has fermera.dident feel as sick with arimidex. i stopped taking the med for a few weeks feel a little  better but still with body pain on and off possibly from possible fibromyalgia.. but i think a might try tomoxifin or aromasin need to reserch a little more.. ill will let you know what happens
Posts.Title: Arimidex and side affects

Posts.Content: do you know if tamoxifin is the same has fermera ,aromasin and arimidex ? my dr. told me that fermera was better for people without there ovaries and for my type of cancer. i had a complete hystorectomy 2008. do you think this is true or did she want to get a kick back like you mentioned.. i have invasive ductal breast cancer of the breast early stage and negative lymph nodes estrogen and progesterone receptor positive. in remission had lumptectomy 2008 .. fermera and arimidex or somthing is making me so sick . severe bodyahces and pains and stiffness on and off worse at times and pain and swelling in my hands with numbness somtimes..do you or anyone know if tamoxfin is a good drug for me ? please let me know ..thank you  kattt
Posts.Title: Arimidex and side affects

Posts.Content: Would like to  know if anyone has tryed fermera and tomxifen ..what were there side effects.. I have a very sensitive stomach and also have mitrial valve prolaspe(mild). Also strokes run in the family..does anyone know which one might be better for me.. Would like to know what the side effects are on both drugs.Tryed fermera before  and gave me really bad body pains and aches.made dr's think i have fibro myalgia so it makes it worse they say. So now my dr.prescribed tomoxifen i am scared to take it  due to my stomach pain recently waiting for my stomach to feel better then i am going to try it.. Please let me know what side effects are from fermera ,tomoifen and arimadex.. Thanks !
Posts.Title: Side Effects Fermara And Tomoxifin

Posts.Content: i have been hearing that tomoxifin if not has bad from one person on this web site .i do not know to much about this issue just starting to reseach..what kind of cancer do you have ?
